item.title: Dec reveals what happens to the treats the I'm A Celeb campmates lose - Her.ie
item.description:
Dec reveals what happens to the treats the I'm A Celeb campmates lose  Her.ie

The campmates haven't had much luck with the Dingo Dollar challenges this year. But it turns out that the unwon treats Declan Donnelly revealed whatreallyhappens to the snacks when the celebrities aren't successful in their efforts to win jam roly-poly, ice pops - or whatever the treat-of-the-day is. No, Kiosk Kev doesn't get them - the crew does. When anI'm A Celebfan asked him if he and Holly were allowed "to much" on the lost Dingo Dollar loot, Dec joked that the behind-the-scenes team were "perverts" for finishing the snacks before he and Holly had a chance. They never make it to us. Cr...

item.title: Nick Knowles becomes sixth contestant to leave I’m A Celebrity - Independent.ie
item.description:
Nick Knowles becomes sixth contestant to leave I’m A Celebrity  Independent.ie

Nick Knowles has become the sixth contestant to face the boot from I’m A Celebrity … Get Me Out Of Here! following a public vote. After his name was called by hosts Declan Donnelly and Holly Willoughby, the television presenter turned to Fleur East, who had also been at risk of leaving, to say: “I’m glad you’re still in, darling.” DIY SOS host Knowles managed 20 days in the jungle and became the camp’s de facto cook, playing a fatherly figure to the group’s younger members. After hugging his campmates, Knowles joined Willoughby and Donnelly in the studio where he said he hoped the camp’s ca...

item.title: Holly Willoughby has had a massive effect on I'm A Celeb's ratings - Her.ie
item.description:
Holly Willoughby has had a massive effect on I'm A Celeb's ratings  Her.ie

Maybe they'll keep her on after this, wha?? In a report that has shocked absolutely nobody, Holly Willoughby has had a striking effect on this year's I'm A Celebrity, Get Me Out Of Here ratings. Because of course she has. She's Holly Willoughby. The This Morning presenter may have brought an array of nice outfits with her to the Australian jungle but she's also brought something else - lots more viewers. The Express reports that this year's instalment of the reality TV show has given ITV its highest ever consolidated ratings, with an average of 12.6 million viewers per night. This is up by ...

item.title: There's one pretty major person missing from the I'm A Celeb WhatsApp group - Her.ie
item.description:
There's one pretty major person missing from the I'm A Celeb WhatsApp group  Her.ie

Awkward... WhatsApp groups can get pretty political. People are always very aware of who is in a group, and often, who has been left out of the group. And it appears that this is something that also effects celebrities. Philip Schofield recently revealed that he's in a WhatsApp group withI'm A Celebhosts, Holly Willoughby and Declan Donnelly. Seems innocent enough, they're all friends sure. HOWEVER, AntMcPartlin, who usually co-hosts the show with Dec, is not in the group. Kind of awkward. Philip opened up about the group, saying it was created in preparation for Holly and Dec heading off t...

item.title: James McVey has head for heights in festive Bushtucker trial - Independent.ie
item.description:
James McVey has head for heights in festive Bushtucker trial  Independent.ie

James McVey navigated a Christmas-themed aerial assault course blindfolded in tonight’s vertigo-inducing Bushtucker trial. Guided by Fleur East, the I’m A Celebrity star was challenged to make his way across the treacherous course, as green ants scurried around inside his clothes. The Vamps star took on the challenge hours before another celebrity was due to leave the jungle following a public vote. Morning in camp saw McVey, pop star East and Inbetweeners actress Emily Atack compete to take part in the day’s Bushtucker trial. James McVey takes on the festive Bushtucker trial (ITV/REX/Shutt...

item.title: Holly Willoughby: I’m happier with my face now that I am older - Independent.ie
item.description:
Holly Willoughby: I’m happier with my face now that I am older  Independent.ie

Holly Willoughby has said she has not always been totally confident in her looks and would not leave the house without mascara on when she was younger. The TV presenter, 37, said she has grown more comfortable with her appearance as she has got older. She told Red magazine: “I feel like now I’m getting older, I’m much happier with my face as it is now than when I was younger. “There was a time where I wouldn’t go out of the house without at least putting mascara on. “Now I literally don’t care. “I’m not afraid of how I look in the mirror.” Holly Willoughby on Red (Chloe Mallet) Willoughby i...

item.title: Noel Edmonds denies feud with Holly Willoughby, says spat was 'silly production squabble' - Independent.ie
item.description:
Noel Edmonds denies feud with Holly Willoughby, says spat was 'silly production squabble'  Independent.ie

Noel Edmonds has denied that he has been feuding with Holly Willoughby. The ex-I’m A Celebrity … Get Me Out Of Here! contestant and the ITV show’s co-host are said to have been at odds since an interview on This Morning in 2016. Edmonds told Good Morning Britain: “I respect Holly as a broadcaster … We had a spat on This Morning.” He said he saw Willoughby on Sunday and added: “We hugged. There is no feud.” Holly Willoughby (Yui Mok/PA) The disagreement on Willoughby’s show This Morning, which Edmonds described as a “silly production squabble”, was said to have been over his views on the cau...

item.description:

Rita Simons became the fourth star to be booted out of the I’m A Celebrity jungle. The former EastEnders actress was sent home during Tuesday’s show following a public vote. It's the end of @OfficialRita's Jungle journey, but what a journey it's been! #ImACeleb pic.twitter.com/iIwfqGpUjS — I'm A Celebrity... (@imacelebrity) December 4, 2018 Simons follows Noel Edmonds, Malique Thompson-Dwyer and Sair Khan out of the jungle. item.title: Malique Thompson-Dwyer leaves I’m A Celebrity after 16 days - Independent.ie
item.description:
Malique Thompson-Dwyer leaves I’m A Celebrity after 16 days  Independent.ie

Malique Thompson-Dwyer has become the second contestant to leave I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! following a public vote. The Hollyoaks star managed 16 days in the jungle but notably struggled with the lack of food, often complaining that he felt weak. Arriving unannounced in the jungle campsite, hosts Declan Donnelly and Holly Willoughby called the camp members together before announcing the 20-year-old as the second celebrity out. After hugging his campmates, Thompson-Dwyer joined Willoughby and Donnelly in the studio where he told them: “I’m just glad to be out now because I’m absol...

item.title: Yikes! Looks like Holly's feud with Noel Edmonds has continued on the I'm A Celeb set - Her.ie
item.description:
Yikes! Looks like Holly's feud with Noel Edmonds has continued on the I'm A Celeb set  Her.ie

If you thought that Holly Willoughby and Noel Edmonds had buried the hatchet over the past few weeks, think again. After clashing two years ago on live TV, the pair came face to face again on this year's I'm A Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here. They fell out onThis Morning when Noel suggested that cancer could be cured by positive energy. They were never going to be able to avoid one another forever and it's now being claimed that Noel's presence on the show has made Holly uncomfortable. "Holly and Noel do not like each other and their bad blood goes right back to the This Morning interview," a ...

item.title: Fans were not happy with Holly Willoughby's latest I'm a Celeb outfit - Her.ie
item.description:
Fans were not happy with Holly Willoughby's latest I'm a Celeb outfit  Her.ie

Ouch. I'm a Celebfans slammed Holly Willoughby for her "inappropriate" dress on last night's episode. The TV presenter wore a black linen dress from Australian brand Hansen & Gretel (around 141) last night, which the company called the "perfect day dress." She teamed it with a pair of Nannette boots from Genson Shoes and a a necklace fromAlighieri Jewellery. However, viewers were less-than-impressed with her outfit, branding it "inappropriate" and calling on her stylist to be sacked. Ouch. One person said: "This outfit is not appropriate for the jungle. It seems, Holly, you are just doing a...

item.title: Holly Willoughby's kids are hanging out on the I'm A Celeb set and ah, god bless them - Her.ie
item.description:
Holly Willoughby's kids are hanging out on the I'm A Celeb set and ah, god bless them  Her.ie

Holly Willoughby's been in Australia for the past while. She's not just been hanging out though and having a laugh. Well, like, she absolutely has but she's also been working on presenting a show and acting as Ant's replacement until he returns to TV while staying in a 5 star hotel every night and also getting paid a hefty sum of money at the end of it all. Seems like a tough enough job. Despite all the trials and tribulations that come with Holly's new job though, at least she got to bring her kids with her for the month or so that she's over there. Nine-year-old Harry, seven-year-old Bell...

item.title: I'm a Celebrity: Declan Donnelly makes Simon Cowell joke during Fleur East's bushtucker trial - The Independent
item.description:
I'm a Celebrity: Declan Donnelly makes Simon Cowell joke during Fleur East's bushtucker trial  The Independent

I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here host Declan Donnelly made a joke about Simon Cowell on Sunday night's (2 December) show, after the music mogul took a swipe at the singer on The X Factor. East, who was a runner up on The X Factor in 2014, was the subject of a joke by Cowell on Saturday 1 December, when he told his 2018 finalist Scarlett Lee that he "didn't want to see her in the jungle drinking worm juice". "I want to see you on Broadway or the West End selling records," he continued. "You've got a big duet to come, Scarlett. This could change your life." Viewers were quick to call out Co...

item.title: Sair Khan ‘smashes’ Sickening Sewer Bushtucker trial on I’m A Celebrity - Independent.ie
item.description:
Sair Khan ‘smashes’ Sickening Sewer Bushtucker trial on I’m A Celebrity  Independent.ie

I’m A Celebrity star Sair Khan triumphed over rats, crabs and cane toads in tonight’s Bushtucker trial, winning 10 stars and earning her fellow contestants a luxurious dinner of eels. The Coronation Street actress, 30, climbed through dark, hot pipes containing a selection of unpleasant animals in the Sickening Sewer challenge. Completing the trial in good time, host Declan Donnelly proclaimed that she had “smashed” the challenge. Trial Tease: Tonight's Bushtucker Trial takes place in the murky Sickening Sewer, but how will Sair fare? Sink or swim? 😲 #ImACeleb pic.twitter.com/2o1GEKzqIn — ...

item.title: This is how early Holly and Dec have to get up to film I'm A Celeb and feck that - Her.ie
item.description:
This is how early Holly and Dec have to get up to film I'm A Celeb and feck that  Her.ie

Yikes! We were skeptical at the beginning but this years series of Im A Celeb is an absolute cracker. Yes, while we have to admit we were nervous about the change of hosts, Holly and Dec have proven themselves to be a killer duo, keeping audiences entertained every night. However, its not all fun and games on set. Holly and Dec have a fairly hectic schedule and it all kicks off incredibly early. The show is filmed in Brisbane, Australia which 10 hours ahead of us, meaning the pair are setting their alarms for a disgustingly early 2am. Yep, hopping out of bed at 2am, the pair are taken to se...

item.title: Noel Edmonds becomes first contestant to exit I’m A Celebrity after public vote - Independent.ie
item.description:
Noel Edmonds becomes first contestant to exit I’m A Celebrity after public vote  Independent.ie

Noel Edmonds has said he is “humbled and proud” after becoming the first contestant to leave I’m A Celebrity following a shock public vote. Arriving unannounced in the jungle campsite, hosts Declan Donnelly and Holly Willoughby called the camp members together. Television presenter Edmonds and EastEnders star Rita Simons were told that they faced being evicted, before Donnelly and Willoughby revealed Edmonds would be the first to go. “Am I supposed to look disappointed?” he joked after his name was called, and the other contestants gathered to embrace him. It's the end of the road for Noel!...

item.title: How Much Holly Willoughby Is Paid... And More I'm A Celebrity Secrets Revealed! - Forbes
item.description:
How Much Holly Willoughby Is Paid... And More I'm A Celebrity Secrets Revealed!  Forbes

(Photo by Steve Parsons/PA Images via Getty Images) Before the latest series of I’m A Celebrity hit screens, there were fears that ratings could possibly take a dramatic nosedive without Ant Partlin co-presenting with his old mucker Declan Donnelly. But since the show kicked off a fortnight ago with ITV darling Holly Willoughby slipping successfully into Ant’s gap, the series has enjoyed MASSIVE ratings, averaging around 10 million viewers a night, crushing its rivals in its wake and making it one of he most watched programmes in the UK right now. So as everyone in the UK seems to be watchi...

item.title: 7 hilarious moments from last night's I'm A Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here - Her.ie
item.description:
7 hilarious moments from last night's I'm A Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here  Her.ie

Day 11 Boy oh boy thatI'm A Celebjungle, am I right? Last night's show saw Malique and Sair take on the dreaded eating edition of the Bushtucker trial, giving them both the chance to prove that they're slightly more interesting than we've seen up to now. Spoiler: They didn't. Dec made a tit of himself in front of a plate of literal cow tits, Harry dropped the joke of the series and Nick Knowles revealed his crippling fear of women's knickers. This is it, we are living in the golden age of television. Truly, what a time it is to be alive. Here's seven hilarious moments from last night's show...

item.title: Campers eat flies and camel’s foot in I’m A Celebrity trial - Independent.ie
item.description:
Campers eat flies and camel’s foot in I’m A Celebrity trial  Independent.ie

Sair Khan and Malique Thompson-Dwyer munched flies, a sheep’s penis and a camel’s foot in the latest stomach-churning I’m A Celebrity Bushtucker trial. The pair were chosen by the public to tackle the Dreaded Deliveries challenge. Hosts Declan Donnelly and Holly Willoughby told the worried stars they would be served up an array of vile jungle takeaways. They would win a star – and therefore a meal for their hungry campmates – for each finished dish. Hollyoaks actor Thompson-Dwyer was first, and had to get through a pizza box of dead mealworms, crickets and cockroaches. Dreaded Deliveries is...

item.title: Richard and Judy: "We respect each other" - RTÉ News
item.description:
Richard and Judy: "We respect each other"  RTÉ News

Richard Madeley has marked 32 years of marriage to Judy Finnigan on a positive note, saying that their relationship has never been hit by a crisis. The former This Morning presenters Madeley (62) and Finnigan (70) first met in 1982. They married four years later, and the couple have two grown-up children, Jack and Chloe. "There’s no great panacea, " Madeley told The Sun. " We’ve had our moments, and the occasional screaming, f*** you row, but it’s always been over something trivial. The couple's daughter Chloe when she competed in Dancing on Ice "We’ve never had marriage counselling, and ne...

item.title: Is it the Holly effect? I’m A Celebrity launch episode breaks ratings record - Independent.ie
item.description:
Is it the Holly effect? I’m A Celebrity launch episode breaks ratings record  Independent.ie

The first episode of the new series of I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! – starring new presenter Holly Willoughby – has become the most-watched launch episode in the show’s history. ITV said the episode has been watched by 13.7 million viewers over the past seven days, according to consolidated data. The overall number has grown from the original overnight ratings, which showed that 11 million people tuned in for the first episode. I'm A Celebrity scores highest launch audience ever, consolidated data reveals. 13.7 million viewers. @imacelebrity Read more... https://t.co/fRIORmOA3b pic....

item.title: Dec took a pop at Holly over what she's being paid for I'm A Celeb and it was glorious - Her.ie
item.description:
Dec took a pop at Holly over what she's being paid for I'm A Celeb and it was glorious  Her.ie

If there's one thing we love finding out about TV stars, it's how much money they're on. Holly Willoughby is reported to be raking it in for her presenting role onI'm A Celebrity Get MeOut Of Here this year. Last night her co-host Dec Donnelly managed to get a quick dig in at her during the show about how expensive she was. Dec teased Holly about not smelling the freshest in the jungle heat before producing a bottle of 'Sheila' perfume that he said cost $3 a litre. "You can afford it, I've read how much you're getting for this AND I've read all about the entourage as well," he jibed. The jo...

item.title: Ant McPartlin 'consulted' for this year's I'm A Celeb link scripts - Her.ie
item.description:
Ant McPartlin 'consulted' for this year's I'm A Celeb link scripts  Her.ie

Ant McPartlin is apparently being "consulted" for this year's I'm A Celebrity, Get Me Out Of Here link scrips and jokes. The presenter has been taking a break from television following a drink driving arrest earlier this year, leaving his jungle duties in the capable hands of Holly Willoughby. However, it turns out that Ant might be more involved with this series than audiences were previously aware. Earlier this week, ITV presenter Emma Jesson took to Twitter to say that she had heard that Ant was being "consulted" about the show's script. In a now deleted tweet, she said: I am informed th...

item.title: I’m a Celebrity 2018 lineup: Full list of contestants, from Noel Edmonds to Harry Redknapp - The Independent
item.description:
I’m a Celebrity 2018 lineup: Full list of contestants, from Noel Edmonds to Harry Redknapp  The Independent

I’m a Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here is back, with a new raft of famous faces entering the jungle. Football manager Harry Redknapp, Torchwood star John Barrowman and X Factor favourite Fleur East lead this year’s contestants, with Noel Edmonds joining the intrepid adventurers (for a reported £500,000 payday) as the series' final contestant. James McVey, who found fame as part of boy band The Vamps, also appears on the show, alongside soap stars Sair Khan (Coronation Street), Rita Simons (EastEnders) and Malique Thompson-Dwyer (Hollyoaks). Who else features? You can see all eleven of this y...

item.title: Holly Willoughby and Declan Donnelly kick off new series of I’m A Celebrity - Independent.ie
item.description:
Holly Willoughby and Declan Donnelly kick off new series of I’m A Celebrity  Independent.ie

Holly Willoughby could not hide her amusement as Declan Donnelly continued to crack jokes during the opening scenes of the new series of I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here!. The This Morning presenter is standing in for Donnelly’s long-time co-host Ant McPartlin as he takes a continued break from his TV commitments. She was jokingly introduced to viewers by Donnelly, who said: “Good morning, good evening, and welcome to Australia where the more eagle-eyed viewers among you would have already noticed a big change to this year’s show, yes, one of the most gorgeous presenters on British telev...

item.title: This is what Phillip Schofield had to say about Holly's debut on I'm A Celeb - Her.ie
item.description:
This is what Phillip Schofield had to say about Holly's debut on I'm A Celeb  Her.ie

She made her first appearance last night. Holly Willoughby finally made her debut on I'm A Celebrity alongside Dec Donnelly last night with viewers eagerly anticipating the return of the hit reality series. Public opinion on the new presenting duo seemed to be fairly split - one half praising Holly for stepping into Ant's shoes and making it her own, and others criticisingthe star for being 'stiff'. Considering Holly is replacing Ant in probably the most iconic tv duo ever, shes absolutely smashed it, no negativity from me #ImACeleb Oli (@oli7242) November 18, 2018 Nah. Holly is just a scri...

item.title: Emily Atack braves a record-breaking 50 snakes in I’m A Celebrity trial - Independent.ie
item.description:
Emily Atack braves a record-breaking 50 snakes in I’m A Celebrity trial  Independent.ie

Emily Atack broke an I’m A Celebrity record by taking on more than 50 snakes in a Bushtucker Trial. The Inbetweeners star was the first of this year’s campers to tackle one of the gruelling trials. In Monday night’s instalment of the ITV show, she had to brave a Viper Pit filled with a variety of pythons and rummage for stars – which represented food for the hungry campers. Atack was shaking as she moved through different chambers in the pit, as hosts Declan Donnelly and Holly Willoughby looked on in horror. There was a terrifying moment when one of the snakes lunged for her hand as she tri...

item.title: Noel Edmonds is served with a sheep’s brain: I’m trying to see a large walnut - Independent.ie
item.description:
Noel Edmonds is served with a sheep’s brain: I’m trying to see a large walnut  Independent.ie

Noel Edmonds puts his visualisation techniques to the test when tasked with eating a sheep’s brain in the jungle. A teaser clip from Saturday night’s I’m A Celebrity … Get Me Out Of Here! shows the star attempting to imagine that the brain served in a sheep’s skull in front of him is in fact a walnut. “I’m trying to engage in what I call corneal realignment protocol, C-R-A-P for short,” he says, sending the show’s hosts Declan Donnelly and Holly Willoughby into giggles. Trial Tease: The reign of the Emperor is over... Bet Noel and Harry wish they could eat their words instead of sheep brain...

item.title: Sarah Caden: 'Holly serves up Ant amnesia in the jungle' - Independent.ie
item.description:
Sarah Caden: 'Holly serves up Ant amnesia in the jungle'  Independent.ie

'It's a little bit different," said Declan Donnelly last weekend, as this year's I'm a Celebrity… Get Me Out of Here! began. "I've never done it with a girl, I usually do it with a bloke." "Let's move on," said his new co-host Holly Willoughby, wagging her finger at him, her eyebrows raised in amused disapproval. There was something irksome about the exchange, which was in part due to the gender stereotypes of naughty boy and scolding girl. Was this exchange going to be the template for the season? Was Dec going to play the dopey bloke whose sidekick slightly mothers him, while all the time...

item.title: We LOVED Holly's €370 dress on I'm A Celeb last night (and we've found a €30 dupe!) - Her.ie
item.description:
We LOVED Holly's €370 dress on I'm A Celeb last night (and we've found a €30 dupe!)  Her.ie

Gorgeous! We have to admit - we've been fairly underwhelmed by Holly Willoughby's looks on this season of I'm A Celebrity. Yes, it's no secret that we adore pretty much everything Holly wears on This Morning and beyond, but her looks down under haven't left us with the same need to purchase the piece - until last night. Holly stepped out for the latest episode of I'm A Celeb in a stunning red zebra print dress that has us scrambling to her Instagram to find out where it was from. The dress in question is from the much-loved brand Rixo London and is one of the most figure-flattering shapes e...

item.title: I'm a Celebrity presenter Joel Dommett rushed to hospital after on-set accident - The Independent
item.description:
I'm a Celebrity presenter Joel Dommett rushed to hospital after on-set accident  The Independent

The presenter of I’m a Celebrity‘s companion show Extra Camp, Joel Dommett, has been rushed to hospital after suffering an injury on set. Dommett was missing from last night’s episode (20 November) after windy conditions reportedly blew a wooden sign onto his head. The 32-year-old comedian required seven stitches. His co-presenters Scarlett Moffatt and Joe Swash presented without him, the former telling viewers: “Unfortunately we’re a man down as Joel isn’t well, but the show must go on.” Dommett posted a photograph of his bandaged head to Instagram, writing: “I had seven stitches like a bi...

item.title: Holly Willoughby shares first snap from the I'm A Celeb jungle and we're SO excited - Her.ie
item.description:
Holly Willoughby shares first snap from the I'm A Celeb jungle and we're SO excited  Her.ie

Not long to go... This years season of Im A Celeb is just hours away from kicking off and nobody is more excited than the new host, Holly Willoughby. Yes, the presenter is stepping in for Ant McPartlin on this years series and has been documenting her preparations over the last few weeks ahead of tonights premiere. And just a few hours ago, Holly shared a first look inside the camp with followers, saying: Welcome to the jungle! "Had a little tour around camp mind blown! Need to get a wriggle on. Weve got new campmates to move in! View this post on Instagram A post shared by Holly Willoughby...

item.title: I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! review: Holly Willoughby has difficult debut while Harry Redknapp misses his bacon sandwiches - The Telegraph
item.description:
I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! review: Holly Willoughby has difficult debut while Harry Redknapp misses his bacon sandwiches  The Telegraph

There were plenty of bugs in the jungle but no Ant as I’m A Celebrity… crashed through the canopy for its latest season. The other conspicuous absence was TV gnome Noel Edmonds, widely touted as a contestant this year but not featured in the first episode. Very much in situ, though, was the absent Anthony McPartlin’s temporary replacement, Holly Willoughby. The This Morning presenter seemed subdued as the curtain rose. First night jitters also emanated from Declan Donnelly, visibly trying too hard to create a spark with his new foil. Meanwhile, we’re still at the getting-to-know-you stage w...

item.title: I'm a Celeb fans were HOWLING at the joke Holly Willoughby made about Dec last night - Her.ie
item.description:
I'm a Celeb fans were HOWLING at the joke Holly Willoughby made about Dec last night  Her.ie

She's a gas woman. Fans watching I'm a Celeb were left laughing out LOUD last night when Holly Willoughby made a joke about Dec. Holly took the absolute piss out of her co-stars height (or lack of it). During a gas intro to the show, Holly said to camera: "I'll be meeting a man who saves hundreds of pounds a year by wearing children's clothes." And we are SCREAMING. Dec replied, saying: "Stop, stop, stop! that was a private conversation." The conversation went on, as the duo discussed the contestants on this years show. Referring to the camp mates, Dec said: "Who gets up at ten to five?" En...

item.title: Here's how much Holly Willoughby's outfit cost for her I'm A Celeb debut last night - Her.ie
item.description:
Here's how much Holly Willoughby's outfit cost for her I'm A Celeb debut last night  Her.ie

It's back! I'm A Celeb officiallyreturned to our TV screens last night and we couldn't be happier. This series unlike previous seasons, not only saw new celebs enter the campsite but also a new presenting face. For the first time since launching in 2002, Declan Donnelly has a new co-host. Replacing Ant McPartlin is This Morning's, Holly Willoughby.
